verses.kjv: Then Nahash the Ammonite came up, and encamped against Jabeshgilead: and all the men of Jabesh said unto Nahash, Make a covenant with us, and we will serve thee.
verses.web: Then Nahash the Ammonite came up, and encamped against Jabesh Gilead: and all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash, “Make a covenant with us, and we will serve you.”
verses.ct: Nahash the Ammonite marched his army up and laid siege to Jabesh Gilead. The men of Jabesh sent word to Nahash: "Make a covenant with us, and we'll serve you."

verses.kjv: And Nahash the Ammonite answered them, On this condition will I make a covenant with you, that I may thrust out all your right eyes, and lay it for a reproach upon all Israel.
verses.web: Nahash the Ammonite said to them, “On this condition I will make it with you, that all your right eyes be gouged out. I will make this dishonor all Israel.”
verses.ct: Nahash the Ammonite replied, "I'll make a deal with you on one condition: I gouge out the right eye of every one of you. That will be my way of humiliating all of Israel."

verses.kjv: And the elders of Jabesh said unto him, Give us seven days’ respite, that we may send messengers unto all the coasts of Israel: and then, if there be no man to save us, we will come out to thee.
verses.web: The elders of Jabesh said to him, “Give us seven days, that we may send messengers to all the borders of Israel; and then, if there is no one to save us, we will come out to you.”
verses.ct: The elders of Jabesh said to him, "Give us 7 days so we can send messengers throughout Israel. If no one comes to rescue us, we'll surrender to you."

verses.kjv: Then came the messengers to Gibeah of Saul, and told the tidings in the ears of the people: and all the people lifted up their voices, and wept.
verses.web: Then the messengers came to Gibeah of Saul, and spoke these words in the ears of the people, then all the people lifted up their voice, and wept.
verses.ct: When the messengers arrived at Gibeah, Saul's hometown, and reported the news to the people, everyone broke down and wept.

verses.kjv: And, behold, Saul came after the herd out of the field; and Saul said, What aileth the people that they weep? And they told him the tidings of the men of Jabesh.
verses.web: Behold, Saul came following the oxen out of the field; and Saul said, “What ails the people that they weep?” They told him the words of the men of Jabesh.
verses.ct: Just then, Saul was coming in from the field behind his oxen. He asked, "What's wrong with everyone? Why are they crying?" So they told him what the men of Jabesh had reported.

verses.kjv: And the Spirit of God came upon Saul when he heard those tidings, and his anger was kindled greatly.
verses.web: God’s Spirit came mightily on Saul when he heard those words, and his anger burned hot.
verses.ct: The Spirit of God rushed upon Saul as he heard the news, and a fierce anger burned inside him.

verses.kjv: And he took a yoke of oxen, and hewed them in pieces, and sent them throughout all the coasts of Israel by the hands of messengers, saying, Whosoever cometh not forth after Saul and after Samuel, so shall it be done unto his oxen. And the fear of the LORD fell on the people, and they came out with one consent.
verses.web: He took a yoke of oxen, and cut them in pieces, and sent them throughout all the borders of Israel by the hand of messengers, saying, “Whoever doesn’t come out after Saul and after Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen.” The dread of LORD fell on the people, and they came out as one man.
verses.ct: He grabbed a pair of oxen, cut them into pieces, and sent the pieces throughout all of Israel with messengers who declared, "Anyone who doesn't march out behind Saul and Samuel — this is what will happen to his oxen!" The fear of the LORD gripped the people, and they rallied together as one.

verses.kjv: And when he numbered them in Bezek, the children of Israel were three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.
verses.web: He counted them in Bezek; and the children of Israel were three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.
verses.ct: Saul counted the troops at Bezek: 300,000 men from Israel and 30,000 from Judah.

verses.kjv: And they said unto the messengers that came, Thus shall ye say unto the men of Jabeshgilead, To morrow, by that time the sun be hot, ye shall have help. And the messengers came and shewed it to the men of Jabesh; and they were glad.
verses.web: They said to the messengers who came, “Tell the men of Jabesh Gilead, ‘Tomorrow, by the time the sun is hot, you will be rescued.’ ” The messengers came and told the men of Jabesh; and they were glad.
verses.ct: They told the messengers from Jabesh Gilead, "Go back and tell your people, 'By the time the sun gets hot tomorrow, you'll be rescued.'" When the messengers delivered this news to the men of Jabesh, they were overjoyed.

verses.kjv: Therefore the men of Jabesh said, To morrow we will come out unto you, and ye shall do with us all that seemeth good unto you.
verses.web: Therefore the men of Jabesh said, “Tomorrow we will come out to you, and you shall do with us all that seems good to you.”
verses.ct: So the men of Jabesh sent word to Nahash: "Tomorrow we'll come out to you, and you can do whatever you want with us."

verses.kjv: And it was so on the morrow, that Saul put the people in three companies; and they came into the midst of the host in the morning watch, and slew the Ammonites until the heat of the day: and it came to pass, that they which remained were scattered, so that two of them were not left together.
verses.web: On the next day, Saul put the people in three companies; and they came into the middle of the camp in the morning watch, and struck the Ammonites until the heat of the day. Those who remained were scattered, so that no two of them were left together.
verses.ct: The next morning, Saul divided his forces into 3 groups. They stormed the Ammonite camp during the last watch before dawn and slaughtered them until the heat of the day. The survivors scattered so completely that no 2 of them were left together.

verses.kjv: And the people said unto Samuel, Who is he that said, Shall Saul reign over us? bring the men, that we may put them to death.
verses.web: The people said to Samuel, “Who is he who said, ‘Shall Saul reign over us?’ Bring those men, that we may put them to death!”
verses.ct: The people said to Samuel, "Where are those men who questioned whether Saul should be our king? Bring them here so we can execute them!"

verses.kjv: And Saul said, There shall not a man be put to death this day: for to day the LORD hath wrought salvation in Israel.
verses.web: Saul said, “No man shall be put to death today; for today LORD has rescued Israel.”
verses.ct: But Saul said, "No one will be put to death today, because today the LORD has brought salvation to Israel."

verses.kjv: Then said Samuel to the people, Come, and let us go to Gilgal, and renew the kingdom there.
verses.web: Then Samuel said to the people, “Come! Let’s go to Gilgal, and renew the kingdom there.”
verses.ct: Then Samuel told the people, "Come, let's go to Gilgal and reaffirm the kingdom there."

verses.kjv: And all the people went to Gilgal; and there they made Saul king before the LORD in Gilgal; and there they sacrificed sacrifices of peace offerings before the LORD; and there Saul and all the men of Israel rejoiced greatly.
verses.web: All the people went to Gilgal; and there they made Saul king before LORD in Gilgal. There they offered sacrifices of peace offerings before LORD; and there Saul and all the men of Israel rejoiced greatly.
verses.ct: So all the people traveled to Gilgal, and there they crowned Saul king before the LORD. They offered peace offerings before the LORD, and Saul and all the men of Israel celebrated with great joy.
